00027 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00028 #include "KviKvsRunTimeContext.h"
00029 #include "KviKvsVariantList.h"
00030 #include "KviKvsVariant.h"
00031 #include "KviWindow.h"
00032 
00033 
00034 class KVIRC_API KviKvsRunTimeCall
00035 {
00036 protected:
00037         KviKvsRunTimeContext  * m_pContext;  // shallow
00038         KviKvsVariantList     * m_pParams;   // shallow
00039 public:
00040         KviKvsRunTimeCall(KviKvsRunTimeContext * pContext,KviKvsVariantList * pParams)
00041                 : m_pContext(pContext),m_pParams(pParams){};
00042         virtual ~KviKvsRunTimeCall(){};
00043 public:
00044         // the script runtime context, never zero
00045         KviKvsRunTimeContext * context(){ return m_pContext; };
00046 
00047         KviWindow * window(){ return m_pContext->window(); };
00048 
00049         // parameter list access & helpers.. almost unused
00050         // because of the KVSM_PARAMETER macros
00051         KviKvsVariantList * parameterList(){ return m_pParams; };
00052         KviKvsVariantList * params(){ return m_pParams; }; // the short version
00053         unsigned int paramCount(){ return m_pParams->count(); };
00054         unsigned int parameterCount(){ return m_pParams->count(); };
00055         KviKvsVariant * firstParam(){ return m_pParams->first(); };
00056         KviKvsVariant * nextParam(){ return m_pParams->next(); };
00057 
00058         // This is virtual and returns false by default
00059         // only few derived classes allow the parameter code to be
00060         // extracted. This is mainly useful in module callback commands
00061         // where a special parsing routine can not be implemented
00062         // but parameter code is needed for later evaluation. (see /addon.register for example)
00063         // Returns false if the parameter code cannot be extracted and true otherwise.
00064         virtual bool getParameterCode(unsigned int uParamIdx,QString &szParamBuffer);
00065 
00066         // forwarders from the context
00067         // this MUST be called before any blocking call that might return to the main event loop
00068         // and eventually quit kvirc or close the window that this command is associated to
00069         // Actually this is a NO-OP but later may really do something that avoids kvirc to crash
00070         void enterBlockingSection(){ m_pContext->enterBlockingSection(); };
00071         // this MUST be called after exiting the blocking section above
00072         // if this function returns false your parsing code MUST "return false" immediately:
00073         // it means that something rather critical happened and the script
00074         // execution cannot continue
00075         bool leaveBlockingSection(){ return m_pContext->leaveBlockingSection(); };
00076 
00077         // forwarders for context: they ease the porting
00078         void warning(const QString &szFmt,...);
00079         bool error(const QString &szFmt,...); // this ALWAYS returns false
00080 };
00081 
00082 #endif //!_KVI_KVS_RUNTIMECALL_H_
